newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan chemical firms set up petchem joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Japan chemical firms set up petchem joint venture.

text.p: Leading chemical firms Mitsui Petrochemical Industries Ltd and Sumitomo Chemical Co Ltd said on Wednesday they had set up a joint venture to produce polyethylene.
The firms said the new company would be capitalised at 400 million yen and be able to produce 200,000 tonnes of linear low density polyethylene annually.
A joint statement said Evolue Japan, owned 75 percent by Mitsui Petrochemical and 25 percent by Sumitomo Chemical, would start commercial production in the spring of 1998.
The plant would be the first in the world to produce linear low density polyethylene using metallocene as a catalyst, they said.
Low density polyethylene is used to make carrier bags and food wrapping and to cover wires.
